Jeff Taylor wrote:

> I have a working junit testcase class that I want to turn into more of a
> stress test. The goal is to spawn multiple threads - each one running
> the test case a fixed number of times (i.e. 100) . This way, we can
> simulate multiple clients.
>
> I'm trying to determine the best approach. To implement a class as a
> thread - you need to have your class extend Thread. The testcase class,
> of course already extends TestCase.
>
> Does anyone have any ideas? Thanks in advance
>

JUnitPerf, an open source set of JUnit test decorators, has a LoadTest that will run an existing
test case with multiple concurrent users and iterations.

    http://www.clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html

Let me know if you have any questions.

Mike
